data.title: CN Oakville Subdivision
authors: Contributors to Train Sim World Wiki
data.meta_description: The CN Oakville Subdivision is the first Canadian route for Train Sim World. It covers Canadian National's Oakville Subdivision from Hamilton to Oakville in Ontario, a distance of 24 miles. The rolling stock included is the GP9rm and GP38-2, both in Canadian National livery. The CN Oakville...
data.text:
The CN Oakville Subdivision is the first Canadian route for Train Sim World. It covers Canadian National's Oakville Subdivision from Hamilton to Oakville in Ontario, a distance of 24 miles. The rolling stock included is the GP9rm and GP38-2, both in Canadian National livery.

Route[]

The CN Oakville Subdivision route covers the mainline between Hamilton and Oakville in Ontario, south of Toronto. Yards are located at both ends of the route, with large industrial areas also located around Hamilton at the southern end of the route. Passenger services run along this route but are not featured in Train Sim World.

Locomotives[]

GP9 - One of the earliest versions of EMD's GP series, these were upgraded by Canadian National in the 1980s, becoming GP9RM locomotives.

GP38-2 - Part of the Dash 2 range of EMD locomotives, the GP38-2 was introduced in 1972, 2222 of these 2000 horsepower locomotives were produced.

Wagons and Coaching Stock[]

5201-Cubic Foot Covered Car

89-foot Bi-Level Auto Rack

30,500 Gallon Tank Car

73-foot center-beam flatcar

Training[]

Oakville Subdivision Introduction - Take a brief ride through Hamilton Industrial Zone and learn what is available to be discovered.

GP9RM Introduction - Learn the basics of operating a GP9RM diesel locomotive and switching cars around a yard.

GP38-2 Introduction - Learn the basics of operating a GP38-2 locomotive and switching cars around a yard.

Ethanol Loading Introduction - Learn how to fill tank cars with Ethanol via the overhead loading gantries.

Scenarios[]

Maple Leaf Motoring - Keep the cars rolling by processing the latest batch of new cars for export.

In with the New - A new cut of tank cars at the vehicle manufacturing plant needed to be tested before they can be put into service.

Petrochemical Chaos - Take on the role of a yard Engineer, loading tank cars around the industrial zone.

Equipment Move - In addition to the train today. three GP9RM locomotives need to be moved to Oakville Yard.

Break it Down - Use a GP9RM to break down a train which has arrived in Aldershot Yard.

Hamilton Explorer - Explore Hamilton Industrial Zone and operate any available locomotive. There are no objectives to complete.

Timetable Mode[]

There are 64 services for each locomotive. Both have the same timetable however are able to run each other's services. Meaning that there is a total of 128 timetables services to complete. They consist of shunting as well as making your way along the tracks between yards with a variety of freight wagons. The timetable can be accessed here: Service Timetable: CN Oakville Subdivision.

Journey Mode[]

There are two different journeys available for this route. They are:

Chapter 1 - GP9RM Driver - Take on the challenge of operating the GP9RM locomotive through its daily duties on Oakville Subdivision.

Chapter 2 - GP38-2 Driver - Try your hand as a GP38-2 locomotive engineer and experience life on the Oakville Subdivision.

Achievements[]

OSD: Master Class: Complete all training modules on Oakville Subdivision

OSD: All in a Day's Work: Complete all scenarios on Oakville Subdivision

OSD: Undivided: Complete all jobs on Oakville Subdivision

OSD: Planting Roots: Reach Route Level 20 on Oakville Subdivision

OSD: Starting Out: Complete 1 service on Oakville Subdivision

OSD: Outstanding Service: Complete 20 services on Oakville Subdivision

OSD: Out with the Old: Complete Oakville Subdivision scenario 'In with the New'

OSD: Building Success: Complete Oakville Subdivision scenario 'Break it down'

GP9RM: Making Connections: Complete 90 coupling tasks in the GP9RM

GP9RM: Taking to the Road: Operate the GP9RM for 90 miles
